entry.def: To go down something such as a slope or a pipe means to go towards the ground or to a lower level.

example.ex: We're going down a mountain...
example.tran: 我们正在下山。

example.ex: A man came down the stairs to meet them...
example.tran: 一名男子下楼来迎接他们。

entry.def: If you are a particular distance down something, you are that distance below the top or surface of it.

example.ex: He managed to cling on to a ledge 40ft down the rock face...
example.tran: 他设法紧紧地攀在了距岩壁顶端 40 英尺的岩礁上。

example.ex: The union leader was last night staging a protest vigil 400 yards down a mineshaft.
example.tran: 昨晚工会领袖在 400 码深的矿井下举行了彻夜的抗议活动。

entry.def: You use down to say that you are looking or facing in a direction that is towards the ground or towards a lower level.

example.ex: She was still looking down at her papers...
example.tran: 她仍低头看着文件。

example.ex: She put her head down, her hands over her face...
example.tran: 她低下头，双手掩面。

entry.def: If you put something down, you put it onto a surface.

example.ex: Danny put down his glass...
example.tran: 丹尼放下了玻璃杯。

example.ex: After two rings I put down the phone...
example.tran: 响了两声后，我放下了电话。

entry.def: If you go or look down something such as a road or river, you go or look along it. If you are down a road or river, you are somewhere along it.

example.ex: They set off at a jog up one street and down another...
example.tran: 他们开始沿着一条又一条的街道慢跑。

example.ex: Karl looked down the street...
example.tran: 卡尔朝街尾看了看。

entry.def: If you are travelling to a particular place, you can say that you are going down to that place, especially if you are going towards the south or to a lower level of land.
entry.tran: (尤指往南方或往地势低的地方)往，朝

example.ex: I went down to L.A. all the way from Seattle...
example.tran: 我从西雅图一路南下到洛杉矶。

example.ex: I have seen him walking down to the shops a mile or so away...
example.tran: 我看见他朝大约一英里以外的商店走去了。

entry.def: If you are down a place, you are at that place. If you go down a place, you go to that place. Some people consider this to be non-standard.

example.ex: People are down the pub, getting drunk...
example.tran: 人们在酒吧，喝得烂醉。

example.ex: We got in the car and went down the supermarket and started buying food.
example.tran: 我们上车前往超市，然后开始购买食物。

entry.def: If an amount of something goes down, it decreases. If an amount of something is down, it has decreased and is at a lower level than it was.

example.ex: Interest rates came down today...
example.tran: 今天利率下调了。

example.ex: Inflation will be down to three percent...
example.tran: 通货膨胀率将降到 3%。

entry.def: If you say that there are a number of things down and a number to go, you are saying how many of the things have already been dealt with and how many remain to be dealt with.
entry.tran: 已处理的及尚未完成的

example.ex: Thirteen months down, twenty-four years to go.
example.tran: 过去了 13 个月，还有 24 年。

entry.def: Down to a particular detail means including everything, even that detail. Down to a particular person means including everyone, even that person.

example.ex: I was a soldier down to my shoelaces.
example.tran: 我是名不折不扣的军人。

example.ex: ...from the chairman right down to the tea ladies.
example.tran: 上至主席下至上茶女侍

entry.def: If you are down to a certain amount of something, you have only that amount left.

example.ex: The poor man's down to his last £3.
example.tran: 那个可怜的人身上只剩 3 英镑了。

entry.def: If a situation is down to a particular person or thing, it has been caused by that person or thing.

example.ex: Any mistakes are entirely down to us...
example.tran: 任何过错全是我们造成的。

example.ex: That's down to pure hard work.
example.tran: 那些全是凭辛苦的劳动得来的。

entry.def: If someone or something is down for a particular thing, it has been arranged that they will do that thing, or that thing will happen.
entry.tran: 已安排…的;要做…的;将发生…的

example.ex: Mark had told me that he was down for an interview.
example.tran: 马克已告诉我他要参加一场面试。

example.ex: ...derelict houses that were down for demolition.
example.tran: 将要拆除的废弃房屋

entry.def: If you are down with an illness, you have that illness.

example.ex: One of the office girls was down with the flu.
example.tran: 一位女职员得了流感。

example.ex: ...a little girl down with that nasty bout of measles.
example.tran: 在麻疹肆虐时染病的小女孩

entry.def: If you pay money down on something, you pay part of the money you owe for it.

example.ex: He paid 20 percent down.
example.tran: 他付了 20% 的钱款。

entry.def: If people shout 'down with' something or someone, they are saying that they dislike them and want to get rid of them.

example.ex: Demonstrators chanted 'down with the rebels'.
example.tran: 示威者高呼“打倒叛徒”。

usage_note.note: Down is often used with verbs of movement, such as ‘fall’ and ‘pull’, and also in phrasal verbs such as ‘bring down’ and ‘calm down’.
usage_note.translation: down 常与 fall，pull 等表示动作的动词连用，也用于 bring down, calm down 等短语动词中。

entry.def: If you are feeling down, you are feeling unhappy or depressed.
entry.tran: 沮丧的;闷闷不乐的;情绪低落的

example.ex: I have been down since the injury happened...
example.tran: 自从受了伤以来我一直很沮丧。

example.ex: Try to support each other when one of you is feeling down...
example.tran: 当有人觉得情绪低落时，要努力相互打气。

entry.def: If something is down on paper, it has been written on the paper.

example.ex: That date wasn't down on our news sheet.
example.tran: 那个日期没有刊在我们的通讯简报上。

entry.def: If a piece of equipment, especially a computer system, is down, it is temporarily not working because of a fault.
entry.tran: (尤指电脑)死机的，发生故障的

example.ex: The computer's down again.
example.tran: 电脑又死机了。

entry.def: If you say that someone downs food or a drink, you mean that they eat or drink it.

example.ex: We downed bottles of local wine.
example.tran: 我们喝了好几瓶本地产的葡萄酒。

entry.def: If something or someone is downed, they fall to the ground because they have been hurt or damaged in some way.

example.ex: Two jet fighters were downed...
example.tran: 两架喷气式战斗机被击落。

example.ex: A bank guard shot him in the leg and downed him.
example.tran: 一名银行警卫开枪击中了他的大腿，使他受伤倒地。

entry.def: to down tools see
Down consists of the small, soft feathers on young birds. Down is used to make bed-covers and pillows.

example.ex: ...goose down.
example.tran: 鹅绒

entry.def: Down is very fine hair.

example.ex: The whole plant is covered with fine down.
example.tran: 整株植物都覆盖着细茸毛。

means.word_mean: 1. soft fine feathers
2. (American football) a complete play to advance the football;
3. (usually plural) a rolling treeless highland with little soil
4. fine soft dense hair (as the fine short hair of cattle or deer or the wool of sheep or the undercoat of certain dogs)

means.word_mean: 2. eat immoderately;

means.word_mean: 5. cause to come or go down;

1. being or moving lower in position or less in some value;

sentences.sentence: "our team is down by a run"

means.word_mean: 2. becoming progressively lower;

sentences.sentence: "the down trend in the real estate market"

means.word_mean: 3. understood perfectly;
4. extending or moving from a higher to a lower place;
5. out;

sentences.sentence: "two down in the last of the ninth"

means.word_mean: 6. lower than previously;
7. shut;
8. cut down;
9. not functioning (temporarily or permanently);

sentences.sentence: "we can't work because the computer is down"

means.word_mean: 10. low in spirits;

sentences.sentence: "lonely and blue in a strange city"
"depressed by the loss of his job"

means.word_mean: 11. the fractional price paid in cash at time of purchase;
1. spatially or metaphorically from a higher to a lower level or position;

sentences.sentence: "rode the lift up and skied down"

means.word_mean: 2. away from a more central or a more northerly place;

sentences.sentence: "was sent down to work at the regional office"

means.word_mean: 3. paid in cash at time of purchase;

sentences.sentence: "put ten dollars down on the necklace"

means.word_mean: 4. from an earlier time;

sentences.sentence: "the story was passed down from father to son"

means.word_mean: 5. to a lower intensity;

sentences.sentence: "he slowly phased down the light until the stage was completely black"

means.word_mean: 6. in an inactive or inoperative state;

sentences.sentence: "the factory went down during the strike"

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English dūn, dūne, shortened from adūne 'downward', from the phrase of dūne 'off the hill' (see down)
Middle English: from Old Norse dúnn

Old English dūn 'hill' (related to Dutch duin 'dune'), perhaps ultimately of Celtic origin and related to Old Irish dún and obsolete Welsh din 'fort', which are from an Indo-European root shared by town

means: [人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 唐地貌名称，来源于古英语，含义是“丘”(down,low hill)
[人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 唐 Dunn的变体
